column4: maybe I should give XP a 5-gig NTFS, make a 65 GB FAT32 partition and then a 10 GB ext3 for Ubuntu.
Then let XP and Ubuntu share the fat32
and if Windows doesn't like it, it can suck ext3's barls
I wish NTFS was convertible to FAT32.
I'll have to back up, reinstall XP, restore it all
he uh, might have data on it? :P
partition magic can convert NTFS to FAT32
If you have used debian for 4 years you're not a noob. :p
I wouldn't know much about that.
